full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/21/2023 Form FS-510 (Chinese-English) (4-63) 21. I am submitting the following personal documents and as part of my application Birth certificate Military record Promise of employment Police certificate(s) Evidence of support or Medical record(s) Other (describe) own resources 22. Name and present residence of my wife/husband is (Give maiden name of wife) None 23. The names and addresses of my children, under 21 years of age are Son Mao Kin-yee, No. 8, Lane 95, Shui Yuan Street, Taipei, Taiwan, Rep. of China. 24. The names of members of my family who are immigrating with me are None 25. ) The name and address of my father is (If deceased, so state, giving date) Mao Guei-sun deceased in 1922. 26. The maiden name and address of my mother is (If deceased, so state, giving date) Lan Yun deceased in 1932. 27. The name and address of FOIA (b)(6) 28. Since my sixteenth birthday my places of residence for 6 months or more have been Country Province City or town (From-To) Rep. of China, Kiangsu, Shanghai. 1930-May Calling or occupation Housework Hong Kong. May 1950-May 1953 Housework Rep. of China, Taiwan, Taipei. May 1953 -present Housework 29. Since my sixteenth birthday I am or have been a member or affiliate of the following political, professional, vocational or social organizations) Name and address (  - Â£) Dates (From - t 1 Type of membership and office held, if any None 30. I speak, read, write the following languages (Include you r native language) Language Speak Read Write Chinese Yes Yes Yes English Yes Little No 31. I have previously been in the United States during following periods (Give year and type of visa or status ) (If never, so state) No 32. United States immigration laws require that all prospective immigrants answer the following questions. This requirement does not imply that you are suspected of being within any of the classes described in these questions. Your answers will assist the consular officer to establish your eligibility to receive a visa. If you are unable to answer any of these questions please explain your inability fully on a separate sheet of paper which you should attach to this form. Please bear in mind that whatever the nature of your answers to these questions, you are not necessarily ineligible to receive a visa. For example, if you were arrested and/or convicted for a minor offense, and the consular officer is able to establish that such offense was in fact a misdemeanor, your arrest and/or conviction would not necessarily make you ineligible for a visa. Give the correct answer to the following questions by circling "Yes" or "No" (1) ? Have you ever been arrested for, Yes No charged with, indicted for or convicted of, a crime or other offense? (b) Have you ever been confined in a civilian prison or jail? (c) Have you ever been confined in a military prison or jail? (d) Have you ever been engaged in illicit buying, selling or handling of narcotic drugs? (e) Have you ever been the beneficiary of pardon, amnesty, rehabilitation decree, other act of clemency or simi lar actio so, explain)
